Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ بِالْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: Knowledge is the annihilator of ignorance

Wisdom: الْأَعْمَالُ بِالْخِبْرَةِ
enWisdom: Actions are [carried out] through know-how

Wisdom: يَحْتَاجُ الْعِلْمُ إِلَى الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: Knowledge needs forbearance

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ رُشْدٌ لِمَنْ عَمِلَ بِهِ
enWisdom: All of knowledge is a proof [against its possessor] except what is acted upon

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ كُلُّهُ حُجَّةٌ إِلَّا مَا عُمِلَ بِهِ
enWisdom: Knowledge is a beauty that does not remain concealed and a relation that does not abandon you [or that is not hidden]

Wisdom: الْعَمَلُ بِالْعِلْمِ مِنْ تَمَامِ النِّعْمَةِ
enWisdom: Acting upon [one’s] knowledge is from the perfection of blessings

Wisdom: اعْمَلُوا إِذَا عَلِمْتُمْ
enWisdom: When you know, act

Wisdom: إِنَّكُمْ إِلَى الْعَمَلِ بِمَا عَلِمْتُمْ أَحْوَجُ مِنْكُمْ إِلَى تَعَلُّمِ مَا لَمْ تَكُونُوا تَعْلَمُونَ
enWisdom: Verily you are in greater need of acting upon what you know than of learning what you don’t know

Wisdom: تَارِكُ الْعَمَلِ بِالْعِلْمِ غَيْرُ وَاثِقٍ بِثَوَابِ الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: The fruit of knowledge is cognizance of Allah

Wisdom: عِلْمُ الْمُؤْمِنِ فِي عَمَلِهِ
enWisdom: Knowledge without action is like trees without fruit

Wisdom: عِلْمٌ بِلَا عَمَلٍ كَشَجَرٍ بِلَا ثَمَرٍ
enWisdom: Knowledge without action is like a bow without a bowstring

Wisdom: عِلْمٌ بِلَا عَمَلٍ كَقَوْسٍ بِلَا وَتَرٍ
enWisdom: Knowledge that is not useful is like a medicine that does not cure

Wisdom: غَايَةُ الْعِلْمِ حُسْنُ الْعَمَلِ
enWisdom: The utmost goal of knowledge is fear of [the displeasure of] Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: فَضِيلَةُ الْعِلْمِ الْعَمَلُ بِهِ
enWisdom: Saying ‘I don’t know’ is half of knowledge

Wisdom: قَلِيلُ الْعِلْمِ مَعَ الْعَمَلِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَثِيرِهِ بِلَا عَمَلٍ [بِغَيْرِ عَمَلٍ‏]
enWisdom: Little knowledge accompanied with action is better than a lot of it without action

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْعَالِمِ جَهْلًا أَنْ يُنَافِيَ عِلْمُهُ عَمَلَهُ
enWisdom: It is enough of ignorance for a scholar that his actions contradict his knowledge

Wisdom: كَمَالُ الْعِلْمِ الْعَمَلُ
enWisdom: For the seeker of knowledge, there is honour in this world and success in the Hereafter

Wisdom: مَنْ عَلِمَ عَمِلَ
enWisdom: One who knows must act upon his knowledge

Wisdom: مَنْ تَعَلَّمَ الْعِلْمَ لِلْعَمَلِ بِهِ لَمْ يُوحِشْهُ كَسَادُهُ
enWisdom: One who gains knowledge so that he can act upon it is not distressed by its dullness

Wisdom: مَنْ عَمِلَ بِالْعِلْمِ بَلَغَ بُغْيَتَهُ مِنَ الْآخِرَةِ وَمُرَادَهُ
enWisdom: One who is fond of knowledge has [actually] done good to his soul

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَعْمَلْ بِالْعِلْمِ كَانَ حُجَّةً عَلَيْهِ وَوَبَالًا
enWisdom: From the perfection of knowledge is acting upon what it dictates

Wisdom: مَا عَلِمَ مَنْ لَمْ يَعْمَلْ بِعِلْمِهِ
enWisdom: He who does not act upon his knowledge has not truly gained knowledge

Wisdom: مَا زَكَا الْعِلْمُ بِمِثْلِ الْعَمَلِ بِهِ
enWisdom: Nothing increases knowledge like acting upon it

Wisdom: مِلَاكُ الْعِلْمِ الْعَمَلُ بِهِ
enWisdom: Coming together to study knowledge is the delight of the scholars

Wisdom: لَا يَتْرُكُ الْعَمَلَ بِالْعِلْمِ إِلَّا مَنْ شَكَّ فِي الثَّوَابِ عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Nobody abandons acting upon [his] knowledge except the one who is doubtful of its reward

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ كَثِيرٌ وَالْعَمَلُ قَلِيلٌ
enWisdom: Knowledge is a great treasure that does not get exhausted

Wisdom: قِوَامُ الدُّنْيَا بِأَرْبَعٍ عَالِمٌ يَعْمَلُ بِعِلْمِهِ وَجَاهِلٌ لَا يَسْتَنْكِفُ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ وَغَنِيٌّ يَجُودُ بِمَالِهِ عَلَى الْفُقَرَاءِ وَفَقِيرٌ لَا يَبِيعُ آخِرَتَهُ بِدُنْيَاهُ فَإِذَا لَمْ يَعْمَلِ الْعَالِمُ بِعِلْمِهِ اسْتَنْكَفَ الْجَاهِلُ أَنْ يَتَعَلَّمَ وَإِذَا بَخِلَ الْغَنِيُّ بِمَالِهِ بَاعَ الْفَقِيرُ آخِرَتَهُ بِدُنْيَاهُ
enWisdom: The mainstay of this world is by four [groups]: A scholar who acts on his knowledge, an ignorant person who is not too proud to learn, a wealthy person who is generous with his wealth to the needy and a poor person who does not sell his Hereafter for his worldly lifeSo when the scholar does not act on his knowledge, the ignorant one refuses to learn; and when the wealthy is miserly with his wealth, the poor one sells his Hereafter for his world

Wisdom: الْعَارِفُ وَجْهُهُ مُسْتَبْشِرٌ مُتَبَسِّمٌ وَقَلْبُهُ وَجِلٌ مَحْزُونٌ
enWisdom: The face of the cognizant one is cheerful and smiling while his heart is fearful and sad

Wisdom: لَا تَجْعَلُوا يَقِينَكُمْ شَكّاً وَلَا عِلْمَكُمْ جَهْلًا
enWisdom: Do not turn your certitude into doubt and your knowledge into ignorance
